node.title: Who is donating to Tasmania's political parties? Good luck finding out
node.alt: Woman hands over Australian money to a man.
node.description: The latest "disclosure" of Tasmania's political party donations is anything but, with Liberal, Labor and the Greens hiding where they got most of their money from — underlining, yet again, the need for electoral reform, writes Adam Langenberg.
node.content:
["The latest \"disclosure\" of Tasmania's political party donations was actually anything but.", "People looking for clarity about where the island's political parties get their funding from would have been sorely disappointed, with staggeringly little details declared.", "The Tasmanian Liberal Party branch disclosed where just $260,000 of the $3.4 million it received came from.", "That equates to just 7.6 per cent and is by far the lowest rate of any Liberal branch around the country.\u00a0", "On the other side of the political aisle, the ALP's Tasmanian branch declared the source of 15.4 per cent of its funding.", "The next worst state ALP branch is South Australia, where 26 per cent of donations were declared.\u00a0", "", "
Total donations received by Tasmania's major political parties in 2020/2021.(Source: AEC\u00a0)
", "They're dreary figures that highlight what Tasmanians have known for years, that the state has the weakest electoral laws\u00a0in the country.", "The state has no political donation restrictions of its own, and rather is governed by Commonwealth regulations.\u00a0", "There are\u00a0long waits for little clarity \u2014 only donations over $14,300 need to be declared annually.", "", "
Businessman Anthony Pratt (centre), with former US President Donald Trump and Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison\u00a0in 2019.(AP: Evan Vucci)
", "
What is known about the donations
", "Of the $260,000 declared by the Tasmanian Liberal Party in 2020-21, $50,0000 came from businessman Anthony Pratt's company Pratt Holdings, $22,000 from New South Wales home builder MJH Group and the same amount from student accommodation builder Scape Australia.\u00a0", "The party also received $50,000, declared during last year's election campaign, from a \"Richard Smith\", with an address registered in Melbourne's south-eastern suburbs.", "The Tasmanian Labor Party received more than half its declared donations from an individual named \"Erin Bromfield\", who donated $103,750.\u00a0", "The party also received funding from the Health and Community Services Union, the Shop Distributive and Allied Employees Association and Sky Bus Australia.\u00a0", "The Tasmanian Greens received a $54,497 bequest from the estate of Elspeth Hope-Johnstone, an artist, education leader, environmental campaigner and former commissioner at the ABC.\u00a0", "They declared where 25 per cent of their donations came from.", "", "
Skybus's parent company BTI Pty Ltd donated $25,000 to Tasmanian Labor.(Facebook:\u00a0Skybus)
", "
Reform coming, we are told
", "The push for donation reform gathered plenty of steam after the 2018 state election campaign, where the gaming lobby waged war against the Labor Party's plan to ban poker machines from pubs and clubs.\u00a0", "Billboards and media advertisements funded by pro-gaming interests popped up everywhere, and the Liberal Party benefited too.\u00a0", "They received $270,000 from the Tasmanian Hospitality Association and Australian Hotels Association, as well as $50,000 from casino operator Federal Group.\u00a0", "", "
Councils will investigate whether pro-pokies signs comply with regulations.(Facebook: Love Your Local)
", "During that campaign, then-premier Will Hodgman committed to a review of electoral donation laws.", "", "
Total donations received by Tasmania's major political parties in 2020/2021 versus the amounts with donors identified.(Source: AEC\u00a0)
", "That review eventually recommended the threshold be reduced to somewhere between $1,000 and $5,000 and donations disclosed more regularly, but when Tasmanians went to the polls last year, they did so under the old system.\u00a0", "Premier Peter Gutwein called the election before tabling new legislation but pledged his party would voluntarily disclose donations over $5,000 within two days during the state election campaign.\u00a0", "The Tasmanian government said\u00a0the wait for reform is nearly over, with new legislation proposing a $5,000 donation threshold set to be introduced in Parliament this year.\u00a0", "A government spokeswoman said\u00a0the Bill, which will see donations disclosed every six months, \"will increase transparency and fairness and is the right thing to do to ensure that the public continues to have faith in the outcomes of elections\".", "Independent MLC Meg Webb said change was needed urgently.\u00a0", "The government said\u00a0it was taking its time to get the legislation right, giving no guarantees that Tasmania would not still be lagging behind the rest of country when next year's data was released."]
